meanings.definition: In a sluggish or inactive manner.
meanings.sent1: He moved torpidly through the thick mud.
meanings.sent2: The bear torpidly emerged from hibernation.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise torpidly raced against the hare.
meanings.sent4: Time torpidly passed as they waited for the train.
meanings.sent5: The old car torpidly sputtered to life.

meanings.sent1: The torpidly cat slept in the sun all day.
meanings.sent2: She felt torpidly after staying up all night.
meanings.sent3: The torpidly flower perked up after a drink of water.
meanings.sent4: The torpidly computer finally crashed after hours of use.
meanings.sent5: The torpidly sloth hung lazily from the tree branch.
